At 04:51 AM 11/07/01, you wrote:
>At 12:05 PM 11/07/2001, Charlie Woloszynski wrote:
> >Anyone had any experience with Cactus (from apache.org) for servlet testing?
>
>I've just started implementing some unit tests using Cactus and I like it.
>It does take a little time to get your head around the architecture, as
>some parts of your unit test code are run on the client, some on the server
>but once over that hurdle it is a 'good thing', particularly for those
>areas of your code that cannot be tested outside a servlet environment.


I'll second those comments - it does take a while to set up and understand, 
but once done, and (as importantly) integrated with ant - it works 
wonderfully.

Note that you can combine it with JUnit style "normal" unit tests for the 
other methods, and HttpUnit tests for the outputs. The three together make 
a pretty powerful suite of tests.


Jim

subject: Re: [junit] Servlet testing...
